Sentencas: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) is a high-performance electrochemical device for energy conversion.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: A single cell is composed of five layers made of different ceramic materials: anode support, anode functional layer, electrolyte, cathode functional layer and cathode.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The mechanical integrity of the cell is a major issue during its lifetime, especially for the electrolyte layer.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Damage of the cells is mainly due to the high operating temperature, the redox behaviour of the anode and the brittleness of the involved materials.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Since residual stresses are known to play a significant role in the damage evolution, it is important to determine them.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: For this purpose, residual stresses in an anode-supported planar SOFC were measured by X-ray diffraction.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Firstly, macroscopic stresses in each phase of each layer were studied using the sin(2)psi method on a laboratory X-ray goniometer at room temperature.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: This technique enables the calculation of residual stress of the material from the measurement of the crystal lattice deformation.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The electrolyte has been found under bi-axial compressive stress of -920 MPa.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Secondly, X-ray measurements controlling depth penetration were made in the electrolyte using grazing incidence method.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The results show that the stress is not homogenous in the layer.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The first five micrometers of the electrolyte have been found less constrained (-750 MPa) than the complete layer, suggesting a gradient of deformation in the electrolyte from the interface with the Anode Functional Layer to the free surface.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Finally, local stress measurements were made on the electrolyte layer by X-ray synchrotron radiation that allows high accuracy measurement on the (sub-) micrometer scale.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Polychromatic and monochromatic beams are used to determine the complete strain tensor from grain to grain in the electrolyte.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: First results confirm the macroscopic stress trend of the electrolyte.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: These X-ray techniques at different scales will contribute to a better understanding of the residual stress in the electrolyte layer and thus to the involved damage mechanisms.
Titulo: Determination of global and local residual stresses in SOFC by X-ray diffraction
